results.description: Wormley is a village in Hertfordshire, England. It is within the Borough of Broxbourne. The village is part of the census ward of Wormley and Turnford, which has a population of 8,146. Wormley is located east of the A10 road which links Cambridge to London, commonly known as the Great Cambridge Road (...)
results.title: Wormley, Hertfordshire

results.description: Brickendon is a village in the civil parish of Brickendon Liberty in the district of East Hertfordshire about 3 miles south of the county town Hertford, and is served by Bayford railway station. Centred around a traditional village green and a friendly village pub, The Farmer's Boy, there is an (...)
results.title: Brickendon

results.description: Hertford Heath is a small village and civil parish near the county town of Hertford in Hertfordshire, England.  (...)
results.title: Hertford Heath

results.description: St Margarets, or more correctly Stanstead St Margarets, is a village and civil parish in the district of East Hertfordshire, Hertfordshire, England. It is located half way between the towns of Hoddesdon and Ware (...)
results.title: Stanstead St Margarets

results.description: Goffs Oak is a large village in the borough of Broxbourne in Hertfordshire in the United Kingdom. It is situated between Cuffley and Cheshunt, just north of the M25 motorway in a slightly more rural section of the London commuter belt (...)
results.title: Goffs Oak

results.description: Broxbourne is a commuter town in the Broxbourne borough of Hertfordshire in the East of England with a population of 13,298 in 2001. It is located 17.1 miles (27.5 km) north north-east of Charing Cross in London and about a mile (1.6 km) north of Wormley and south of Hoddesdon (...)
results.title: Broxbourne

results.description: Hertingfordbury is a small village and civil parish in Hertfordshire, England, close to the county town of Hertford. It was mentioned in the Domesday Book.  (...)
results.title: Hertingfordbury
